messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 967
messages.msgSnippet: ... I don t.  I *use* it, but I don t pick it apart, analyze it, assign words like subject, predicate, pluperfect, etc. to each sentence I read, speak or hear;
messages.messageBody:
on 8/5/03 3:48 PM, Retta Fontana at rettafontana@... wrote:

> "If you're not an English teacher, you don't look at the rules on a regular
> basis.'' Anyone who reads books or speaks to another human being studies
> grammar.

I don't. I *use* it, but I don't pick it apart, analyze it, assign words
like subject, predicate, pluperfect, etc. to each sentence I read, speak or
hear; I just read, listen and speak.

Nancy

messages.subject: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 967
messages.msgSnippet: If you re not an English teacher, you don t look at the rules on a regular basis.  Anyone who reads books or speaks to another human being studies grammar.
messages.messageBody:
"If you're not an English teacher, you don't look at the rules on a regular basis.'' Anyone who reads books or speaks to another human being studies grammar.

Retta
